extractions: {"position": null, "sentence": "However, a Pearson\u2019s correlation coefficient shows that there is no relation between the time taken to complete the localization task and the localization error (r(30) = 0.104, p = 0.570)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "30", "pcor": "0.104", "pval": "0.570"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Here we found a positive correlation between the average (over all conditions) anthropomorphism score and the distance ( RPLUS MATCH , and a positive correlation between the average (over all conditions) animacy score and the distance (r(38) = .4337, p = .005", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "38", "pcor": ".4337", "pval": ".005"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Each correlation was strong (max and mean:  RPLUS MATCH ; max and median: r(188) = .78, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "188", "pcor": ".78", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "We found a positive correlation between accuracy and user preference (Pearson\u2019s r(5) = 0.68, p < 0.05", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "5", "pcor": "0.68", "pval": "0.05"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As shown in Figures 7a,b, the values were strongly correlated, with sim-K1 had Pearson\u2019s  RPLUS MATCH , and sim-K2 had Pearson\u2019s r(99) = 0.62, p < 0.01", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "99", "pcor": "0.62", "pval": "0.01"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The correlation between capacity and mean specificity was also significantly positive (r(188) = .82, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "188", "pcor": ".82", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The model predictions strongly correlated with the mean accuracy data in Fig. 5F (r(54) = .83, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".83", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As previously, a Pearson\u2019s correlation coefficient shows no relation between the time taken to complete the navigation and the number of missed objects (r(30) = 0.021, p = 0.835)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "30", "pcor": "0.021", "pval": "0.835"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Considering the visual variables with respect to total immersion, a small correlation was found with screen width  RPLUS MATCH , frames per second  RPLUS MATCH  (figure 5 left), and contrast (r(401) = 0.125, p = 0.012)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "401", "pcor": "0.125", "pval": "0.012"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As shown in Figures 7a,b, the values were strongly correlated, with sim-K1 had Pearson\u2019s r(99) = 0.78, p < 0.01", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "99", "pcor": "0.78", "pval": "0.01"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Indeed we found that scenario duration and event count were strongly correlated (Pearson\u2019s r(68) = 0.77, p < 0.001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "68", "pcor": "0.77", "pval": "0.001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Here we found a positive correlation between the average (over all conditions) anthropomorphism score and the distance (r(38) = .5504, p = 0.0002", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "38", "pcor": ".5504", "pval": "0.0002"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The design, displays, and procedure were the same as Experiment 1, except we tested the colors and fruits in Fig. 3B (Table S.1). 5.2  Results and discussion  The colors and fruits in Experiment 1 and 2 differed in that their patterns of perceptual distances were uncorrelated ( RPLUS MATCH ) but their patterns of semantic distances were almost perfectly correlated (r(26) = .99, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "26", "pcor": ".99", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Task performance (percent correct) was also strongly negatively related to workload, r(253) = -.35, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "253", "pcor": "-.35", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Model predictions were strongly correlated with mean RTs (r(54) = .82, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".82", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Perceptual distances in Experiment 1 and Experiment 2 were also uncorrelated (r(26) = .08, p = .673", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "26", "pcor": ".08", "pval": ".673"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Each correlation was strong (max and mean: r(188) = .86,p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "188", "pcor": ".86", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "With respect to the two potential mediators meditation experience and daily self-reported motivation, we found that meditation experience is unrelated to accuracies (M = 1.80/3, SD = 0.56, r(224) = .03, p = .65", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "224", "pcor": ".03", "pval": ".65"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "From these results, we can generate a function of the form: T I =\u03b20 + \u03b21 \u00d7 x1 + \u03b22 \u00d7 x2 + \u03b23 \u00d7 x3 + ... + \u03b2m \u00d7 xn  (1)  5.1.2 Simple Model with Interactions Since the interaction between variables can affect the final result, this multivariate model considers the interactions between each pair of independent variables.  \f Immersion Metrics for Virtual Reality  7  Fig. 5 Relationship between frames per second and total immersion (r(401) = 0.148, p < 0.01)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "401", "pcor": "0.148", "pval": "0.01"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "In line with H1b, the lower participants\u2019 cognitive load during HRI, the more trust they showed towards the robot after HRI r(24) = -.41, p = .019", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "24", "pcor": "-.41", "pval": ".019"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The model predictions strongly correlated with the mean RTs in Fig. 6B (r(54) = .88, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".88", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "We found a positive correlation between the agreeableness score and the distance ( RPLUS MATCH ), and a weak positive correlation between the conscientiousness score and the distance (r(38) = .327, p = .04", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "38", "pcor": ".327", "pval": ".04"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Capacity was positively correlated with both distribution difference ( RPLUS MATCH ) and mean specificity (r(4843) = .61, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "4843", "pcor": ".61", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "In Experiment 1, perceptual distance (Fig. 5C) deviated from semantic distance (Fig. 5A) but the two variables were still correlated (r(26) = .71, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "26", "pcor": ".71", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Indeed, there were significant correlations between the patterns of accuracy ( RPLUS MATCH ) and RT (r(54) = .79, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".79", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Considering the visual variables with respect to total immersion, a small correlation was found with screen width  RPLUS MATCH , frames per second (r(401) = 0.148, p < 0.01)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "401", "pcor": "0.148", "pval": "0.01"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Motivation correlates positively with accuracy in this study (M = 3.98/5, SD = 0.92, r(224) = .18, p = .006", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "224", "pcor": ".18", "pval": ".006"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Given that the pattern of association strengths across colors in Experiment 2 (Fig. 3B.1) was similar to Experiment 1 (Fig. 3A.1), the pattern of semantic distances were strongly correlated between the two experiments (r(26) = .99, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "26", "pcor": ".99", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The predictions strongly correlated with participant responses over the full dataset of 4 colors \u00d7 16 4-concept sets (r(126) = .95, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "126", "pcor": ".95", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Across the 28 color pairs for each of the two targets, association strength between the target and correct color was moderately correlated with semantic distance ( RPLUS MATCH ) and not significantly correlated with perceptual distance (r(54) = .21, p = .123", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".21", "pval": ".123"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "For the experience with robots score, we found a negative correlation with the Likeability subscale (r(38) = -.322, p = .044", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "38", "pcor": "-.322", "pval": ".044"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "We find a small positive trend between daily signal quality and daily accuracies (r(224) = .13, p = .06", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "224", "pcor": ".13", "pval": ".06"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Across the 28 color pairs for each of the two targets, association strength between the target and correct color was moderately correlated with semantic distance (r(54) = .43, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "54", "pcor": ".43", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The correlation between capacity and distribution difference over all 190 2-concept sets was strongly positive (r(188) = .93, p < .001", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "188", "pcor": ".93", "pval": ".001"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Its relation to the insights is neutral regarding the characteristic of breadth versus depth (r(12) = -0.047, p = 0.873)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "12", "pcor": "-0.047", "pval": "0.873"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Interestingly, on the 12Q-in-lab subjects, we found that there is a moderate but significant correlation (r(17) = 0.46, p = 0.049)", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "17", "pcor": "0.46", "pval": "0.049"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "For the experience with robots score, we found a negative correlation with the Likeability subscale ( RPLUS MATCH ); for age, we found a positive correlation with the Likeability subscale (r(38) = .369, p = .019", "statisticType": "cpearson_apa", "record": {"doF": "38", "pcor": ".369", "pval": ".019"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
